fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.types

Interface IDecimalType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    INumberType, IType

    public interface IDecimalType
extends INumberType
    Cell data type representing a decimal number type. Unlike floating point numbers, decimal numbers are always accurate within the specified precision (no optimizations are performed that would result in losing precision).

    The decimal type reflects the concepts of precision (total number of digits) and scale (number of digits after the decimal point).

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be immutable and therefore completely thread-safe.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IFloatType

    • Method Detail

      • getPrecision

        int getPrecision()
        Gets the precision of the decimal type. For example, the decimal value 123.45 requires a precision of 5.
        Returns:
        the non-negative precision.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getScale

        int getScale()
        Gets the scale of the decimal type. For example, the decimal value 123.45 requires a scale of 2.
        Returns:
        the scale.
        Since:
        1.0
